block.p: Michelle Fischer, a daughter of Jacqueline and Stanley Fischer of Great Neck, N.Y., is to be married today to David Kaplan, a son of Lily Kaplan and Joseph Kaplan of New York. Rabbi Jacob J. Schacter is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Keter Torah in Teaneck, N.J.

The bride, 25, and the bridegroom, 28, work in Jerusalem, she as a quality assurance technician for DeltaThree.com, which provides phone service over the Internet, and he as a sales and marketing associate at Surfnotes, a company that designs software for wireless Internet applications.

Michelle Fischer, a daughter of Jacqueline and Stanley Fischer of Great Neck, N.Y., is to be married today to David Kaplan, a son of Lily Kaplan and Joseph Kaplan of New York. Rabbi Jacob J. Schacter is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Keter Torah in Teaneck, N.J.

The bride, 25, and the bridegroom, 28, work in Jerusalem, she as a quality assurance technician for DeltaThree.com, which provides phone service over the Internet, and he as a sales and marketing associate at Surfnotes, a company that designs software for wireless Internet applications.
The bride graduated from Queens College. Her father is the managing partner of Fischer & Burstein, a law firm in Great Neck and New York, and her mother is the controller of the firm.

The bridegroom graduated from Yeshiva University. His mother is a broker for the William B. May Company, the New York real estate concern. His father is a senior partner in Ross & Hardies, a law firm, and the president of the Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services, both in New York.
